Translate By ChatGPT.
After several attempts and giving up, I finally decided to pick up my personal blog again. On the one hand, I hope to share some of my thoughts on work and life with everyone, and on the other hand, I also want to exercise my writing ability.
Work well with tools As a tool enthusiast, I always have difficulty choosing tools. Considering that the main purpose of a blog is to write something down, I still use the simplest Github Pages + Hugo to build it. The PaperMod theme recommended by my friend is also very much in line with my aesthetics. Here, I will make a brief review of the construction of the entire blog.
Overall structure Hugo configuration Hugo itself is implemented using the Go language, and its configuration has a certain learning curve. It is recommended to copy and update an existing yml file directly. Here is my configuration file:
baseURL: https://lividhyper.github.io/ defaultContentLanguage: zh-cn theme: hugo-PaperMod summary: archives enableEmoji: true enableRobotsTXT: true # 自动检测是否包含 中文日文韩文 如果文章中使用了很多中文引号的话可以开启 hasCJKLanguage: true # 每页显示的文章数 pageinate: 10 # 浏览器显示方式 permalinks: post: "/:title/" # 开启标签tag taxonomies: category: categories tag: tags series: series entag: entags languages: zh-cn: title: Livid的博客 contentDir: content/zh menu: main: - identifier: archives name: 文章 url: archives/ weight: 1 - identifier: tag name: 分类 url: tags/ weight: 10 - identifier: search name: 搜索 url: search weight: 20 - identifier: collection name: 资料 url: collection/ weight: 20 - identifier: about name: 关于&友链 url: about weight: 30 en: title: Livid's Blog contentDir: content/en menu: main: - identifier: archives name: Post url: archives/ weight: 1 - identifier: entag name: Tags url: entags/ weight: 10 - identifier: search name: Search url: search weight: 20 - identifier: collection name: Collection url: collection weight: 40 - identifier: about name: About url: about weight: 50 params: # 开启SEO env: production author: livid ShowReadingTime: true homeInfoParams: Title: xx Content: xx comments: true socialIcons: # optional - name: github url: "https://" - name: twitter url: "img/twitter.png" - name: RSS url: "index.xml" # 允许代码被拷贝 ShowCodeCopyButtons: true fuseOpts: isCaseSensitive: false shouldSort: true location: 0 distance: 1000 threshold: 1 minMatchCharLength: 0 keys: ["title", "permalink", "summary"] outputs: home: - HTML - RSS - JSON # is necessary searchHidden: true Automatically publish using Github Actions We can set up two repositories: one for storing articles, which can be named blog and can be set to a Private repository; the other for storing external static resources, which needs to be set to a Public repository. The secrets and configurations of Github Action are not mentioned too much here. Here is an example of my .github/workflows/deploy.yml:
name: deploy on: push: workflow_dispatch: jobs: build: runs-on: ubuntu-latest steps: - name: Checkout uses: actions/checkout@v2 with: submodules: true fetch-depth: 0 - name: Setup Hugo uses: peaceiris/actions-hugo@v2 with: hugo-version: "latest" - name: Build Web run: hugo - name: Deploy Web uses: peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v3 with: PERSONAL_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.PERSONAL_TOKEN }} EXTERNAL_REPOSITORY: lividHyper/lividHyper.github.io PUBLISH_BRANCH: main PUBLISH_DIR: ./public commit_message: ${{ github.event.head_commit.message }} Image Hosting Configuration Since I use Github to host my blog, I will skip the configuration of an image hosting service and simply embed the images directly into my blog as static resources.
Comments Since my blog is not yet heavily trafficked, I will hold off on introducing a commenting system for now. I will consider implementing a more mature solution in the future.
